title: European Pioneer in Mobile Targeting Data
Management: Andrea Girardello, Ivan Delchev, Andreas Budde, Bo Wang
description: 42matters, headquartered in Zurich is a high-tech company and pioneer in mobile app marketing. The company has developed an innovative solution to targeting customers, by creating profiles based on a user’s app-graph. 42matters’ customers include advertising companies and telecommunications organisations, as well as big and small app developers. 42matters collects data, profiles it and then offers this data in several leading DMPs to a broad group of advertisers. 42matters is also developing one of the most comprehensive App Market APIs available worldwide. 42matters AG was founded in 2011 by Andrea Girardello, Ivan Delchev, Andreas Budde and Bo Wang.

title: Optimizing Advertiser's Social Media Campaigns
description: Adglow has been investing heavily to build its own social media demand-side platform (DSP), creating niche technology to be able to efficiently buy social media inventory in video, mobile and search engine channels. Their powerful software along with Facebook (Marketing Partner) and Twitter (Marketing Platform Partner) certifications put Adglow in a strategic position to be able to offer both advertisers and agencies the best technology to meet their social media advertising needs: ADAM. ADAM is not just Adglow’s proprietary DSP for social media, allowing advertisers to purchase inventory in social media through real-time bidding (RTB); it also helps Adglow professionals around the world to design, manage, optimize and extract data and key insights from social media ad campaigns.

title: Personalized Men's Fashion
Investment: Acquired by family business Grünberg in June 2013
description: AMERANO is an online shop for personalized men´s fashion. From suit to shoes, from cashmere jersey to cufflink, each detail can be personalized. Through individual style advice look and correct fit are guaranteed. After the first online order, the customer’s clothing sizes are saved, which makes repeat orders or corrections convenient. The products are manufactured in Europe and directly shipped to the customer.

title: Second to none in AI powered computer vision
Management: Dr. Daniel Cremers,  Till Kaestner, Andrej Kulikov
description: Founded by renowned researchers, industry experts, and company builders, Artisense develops AI-based computer vision solutions for vehicle automation and robotics. Based on dynamic 3D maps, which are combined in an Internet of Vehicles, Artisense’s technology enables navigation of autonomous vehicles without GPS or expensive sensors and hardware. As a spin-off of the chair of Prof. Daniel Cremers of the Technical University of Munich, Artisense builds on 10 years of research and cooperation with leading OEM, T1, and technology companies.

title: Digital Infrastructure for Education
Management: Adrian Franklin, Anders Krohn, Oliver Nicolini, Rune Kvist
description: Aula is a communication platform built for education that replaces emails and learning management systems (e.g. Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard, D2L) with digital infrastructure designed to encourage interaction and engagement. Aula was founded at the University of Oxford by Anders Krohn, Oliver Nicolini and Adrian Franklin who were driven to build Aula based on their experiences as students at universities across the globe. The institutional version of Aula was launched in September 2017 and early adopter universities include Ravensbourne, the University of Nottingham, the Royal College of Art and the University of Derby. Aula brings together students, staff, and educators — think of it as an institution’s digital campus.

title: The  Mobility Platform for Fleet Management and Mobility Sharing
Management: Peter Jegutzki, Andreas Kopf, Patric Schneider
description: AZOWO provides a B2B mobility platform to manage and optimize vehicle fleets. With its flexible, cloud-based fleet management software and mobility sharing solution, AZOWO enables efficient management and effective optimization of fleets and vehicle pools. The solution provides the highest data transparency, automated processes, and sound statistics and reports. AZOWO, which headquartered in Biberach (Germany), has been founded in 2015 by Peter Jegutzki, Andreas Kopf, and Patric Schneider.

Carl is an M&A platform for SMEs, connecting owners, advisors, and acquirers around opportunities from €1mn to €50mn in transaction value. Carl’s private deal network, a dedicated SaaS solution that guides the process and partnerships with numerous associations, banks, and more than 220 M&A advisors, connects more than 1,300 accredited buyers to more than 120 opportunities. Carl’s mission is to offer the “Mittelstand” the same access to professional and efficient M&A services that large cooperations have had access to since long ago.

title: First Italian iBuyer - sell your home within 30 days!
description: Casavo’s mission is to make buying and selling residential property as simple and pleasant as possible. Casavo’s automated valuation engine takes more than 70 variables into account and immediately provides potential sellers with the fair value of their property – and a purchase offer. Upon acceptance of the offer, Casavo arranges a free inspection of the property and the seller receives the full cash payment within 30 days. The property is eventually renovated and sold to the next owner directly by Casavo. A clear and transparent process which fosters customer confidence and peace of mind. The combination of technological edge paired with the team’s focus on flawless execution enables Casavo to decrease time to sell – which ultimately is of the highest value to the customer.

title: Curated Online Auctions For Exceptional Objects
description: Catawiki is a global online auction platform which unites buyers and sellers of special objects and collectibles in a unique way. The company was founded in 2008 by a Dutch comic book collector and a Dutch developer as a community for collectors. Since 2011, Catawiki has been hosting weekly auctions for special objects, from comic books to classic cars and everything in between. In-house experts curate every auction, guaranteeing varied, high-quality selections of auction lots. Catawiki's unique payment system also provides buyers and sellers with a secure and simple means of transaction. With millions of visitors from across the world every month, Catawiki is the most trusted place for selling high-quality and hard-to-find objects online.

title: AI Booking Platform for Business Travel
Management: Michael Riegel, Jannik Neumann, Marko Schilde and Slobodan Utvic
description: Comtravo makes booking and managing business trips as simple as sending an email. Comtravo’s software translates text requests such as email into structured queries using natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence technology to provide the best travel options for individual travelers based on specified preferences as well as previous booking behavior. This way, users can quickly book personalized offers with one click directly in the email.

title: Parts For Pros:  The One-Stop Shop For MRO Parts
Investment: Seed (Exited in June 2017 to Hoffmann SE)
Management: Dr. Frederick Roehder, Dr. Richard Schwenke, Tobias Tschötsch
description: Contorion is an online store for industrial and trade supply. The extensive assortment covers a wide range of product categories, from screws to electrical and hand tools to work clothes of many renowned manufacturers. With high user-friendliness, a professional customer service and short delivery times Contorion would like to be the one-stop shop for business and private customers. The company was founded by Dr. Frederick Roehder, Dr. Richard Schwenke and Tobias Tschötsch in Berlin in the spring of 2014.

title: Worldwide Shipping For Merchants
description: Coureon Logistics is a new digital logistics provider for national & international parcel shipping. The Coureon platform combines multiple 3rd party logistics fleets into a unique network. Online merchants, SMEs, and enterprise clients can ship to over 190 destinations and save between 20% and 50% on their shipping costs, without any upfront investment and with just one integration. The company cooperates with over 100 logistics players worldwide. Coureon was founded in 2015 by Federico Frascà in Berlin.

title: The Customer Engagement Platform for Cross-Channel Marketing and CRM
description: CrossEngage combines a real-time customer data platform with cross-channel campaign management. The technology enables customer loyalty and thus increases marketing profitability through personalised, real-time campaigns across all channels. Customers include Deutsche Bahn Vertrieb, HelloFresh, Contorion, BodyChange, Stylefile, Friendsurance and Mycs. In addition to Vorwerk Ventures, Project A, Earlybird Venture Capital, VC Fonds Kreativwirtschaft managed by IBB Beteiligungsgesellschaft, Capnamic Ventures, Ventech, 42 Capital and Cavalry Ventures, the sponsors include numerous business angels who are prominent in the field. The Berlin location currently employs 45 people.

title: The Customer Friendship Platform
description: Dixa offers a real-time, channel-neutral and cloud-based customer service platform including phone, chat, e-mail, and Facebook messenger. Dixa’s mission is to end bad customer service and empower customers and businesses to build stronger bonds. In 2018 Dixa was announced EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award for Start-up of the Year in Denmark.

title: Digital Marketing Agency and Global Technology Provider
description: ESV Digital Brazil employs a team of cross-channel analysts and program managers who use the comprehensive inhouse technology ESV platform to manage clients’ accounts and support technology licensees. It combines tracking, reporting, and bid management in one platform alongside a suite of power-tools such as automated campaign analysis, mass updates, catalogue methodology, raw request. The platform is a tool for any paid search marketer trying to leverage maximum benefit from paid search. Headquartered in Paris, with offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Ann Arbor, Madrid, Milan, Oslo, Bertrange and now São Paulo, ESV Digital Group employees over 200 digital marketing professionals who are working with more than 250 clients.

title: Online Shop For Curated Premium Wines
Management: Ari Gorenstein, Marcos Leal, Olivier Raussin
description: Evino is an innovative online wine business, founded in April 2013 by Ari Gorenstein and Marcos Leal in São Paulo, Brazil. Evino enables its Brazilian customers to get to know and to appreciate the culture of wine drinking. In the exclusive online store, customers are offered a broad and weekly changing assortment of premium wines with an excellent value-for-money. Alternating, limited and thematically oriented flash sales offering a variation chosen premium wines.

title: Leading Source For 3rd Party Audience Data For Advertisers
Location: Headquarters: Singapore; offices in Berlin, London, Melbourne, New York, Sydney & Tokyo
Management: Kevin Tan, Kristina Prokop, Trent Lloyd, Jill Orr (COO)
description: Eyeota is the global leader for audience data with over 3.5 billion unique profiles. Eyeota provides marketers with the data they need to reach the right online audiences and cut campaign waste whilst also enabling publishers to monetise their audiences more widely. In addition, our data delivers deep audience insight to both marketers and online publishers to help them understand their customers in a new way – as human beings. Eyeota supplies third party audience data to all major global and regional ad buying platforms, trading desks, DSPs, DMPs and ad networks. The company was founded in 2010 and has offices in Berlin, London, Melbourne, New York, Singapore, Sydney, and Tokyo.

title: Insurance Rate Monitoring Service
Management: Hanno Fichtner, Krzysztof Kujawa, Vincenz Klemm and Pawel Olszewski
description: Gabi is a personal insurance platform that ensures customers always have the right coverage at the best price. Gabi has launched in CA in January 2017 and is backed by A Capital, Project A, SV Angel and a group of angels. It was founded in 2016 by Hanno Fichtner, Krzysztof Kujawa, Vincenz Klemm and Pawel Olszewski.

title: Online Print Platform
description: Founded in 2013, Helloprint’s platform business is expanding rapidly into the European market. Currently, over 150.000 customers in the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Italy, United Kingdom, Spain, Germany and Ireland are ordering their printed products via the platform. Via a network of hundreds of international print and promotional producing partners over 2.000 unique printed products are available for its customers, anywhere and when they need it. The company operates from Rotterdam, The Netherlands, where it has its European HQ, and from Valencia, Spain, where the international Customer Experience Center is located.

title: Data-Driven Real Estate Divestment
Management: Steffen Wicker, Dmitri Uvarovski, Philipp Reichle
description: Selling and buying real estate is getting easy and convenient: Homeday defines the new quality standards in real estate. Homeday combines in-depth market intelligence with daily updated data on market conditions,and pricing; and innovative technologies with professional, personal advice. Homeday experts develop tailor-made marketing strategies that perfectly fit the object and the people behind it. In 2014 Homeday was founded by Steffen Wicker, Dmitri Uvarovski and Philipp Reichle. Today a team of more than 60 employees supports sellers and buyers; from the intention to sell to signing the contract throughout the whole process.

title: E-Commerce Luggage Brand
Management: Stefan Holwe, Jan Hendrik Roosen, Margarete Schellong
description: Horizn Studios is an online-first travel brand headquartered in Berlin. Their team of engineers and designers develops innovative travel products and services for the digital age. From the brand’s iconic range of smart luggage to its innovative travel essentials and services, each product is designed to help you travel with ease and joy. Launched in 2015 by Stefan Holwe and Jan Roosen, Horizn is Europe’s leading luggage brand for the next generation.

title: Logistics Gateway for E-Commerce
description: Intelipost is a Software as a Service company based in São Paulo, Brazil. With its Logistics Gateway API it connects e-commerce businesses to all main Brazilian logistics providers. In its unique platform, the company integrates the comparison and quotation of various transportation options as well as delivery tracking. Generating insights through automated Business Intelligence solutions Intelipost provides real time updates on freight costs, average delivery times and the overall quality score of the different providers. Thus it enables its customers to manage the entire delivery process and to optimize the logistics costs and efficiency of their operations. Intelipost was founded in March 2014 by CEO Stefan Rehm and Gabriel Drummond.

title: The Virtual Restaurant Chain For Fresh And Healthy Food
description: Keatz (former GuruCollectiv) is a virtual restaurant chain delivering healthy foods such as salads, quinoa bowls, yogurts, mueslis and cold pressed juices. The company's goal is to become the leading household and office brand for on-demand fast casual delivery food. Keatz exclusively focuses on fresh salads and other ready-to-eat snacks, which are delivered through ecofriendly electric scooters. Keatz was founded in January 2016 by Paul Gebhardt and Dimitrios Ploutarchos.

title: THE Address For Car Parts And Accessories
description: kfzteile24 is a Berlin-based multichannel retailer in the field of car parts and accessories which provides car parts for hobbyists and professionals alike. The company generates most of its revenue via their online shops www.kfzteile24.de and www.autoteile24.de. In addition to their online shops, they run three chain stores with attached workshops in Berlin. kfzteile24 was founded in 2001 by Matthias Kieper and Torsten Hainke.

title: The Healthcare Messaging Platform
description: Klara was founded in 2013 with the vision to change the broken healthcare experience by directly connecting doctors and patients through technology. Klara’s secure and HIPAA-compliant medical messaging platform allows providers and patients to centralize all their medical communication in one simple and secure app. Doctors and their teams can collaboratively treat and communicate with their patients, adding external providers and other medical partners (such as pharmacies, labs and insurance companies) to the conversation to streamline patient care. Klara has been founded in 2013 by Simon Bolz und Dr. Simon Lorenz with offices in New York and Berlin.

title: Delivered Cooking Boxes With Seasonal Recipes And Fresh Ingredients
description: Kochzauber is a Berlin-based startup with the mission to enable healthy and tasty cooking every day with an innovative, convenient nutrition concept. With its Kochzauber boxes, the company offers varied, healthy recipes with matching, fresh ingredients. The boxes are delivered all over Germany directly to the customer's home. All recipes are developed by nutrition experts, adapted to the customer needs. Furthermore, Kochzauber is leading in offering individual cooking boxes: for example for vegetarians, families, fitness enthusiasts or seasonal events — individual and for everyone’s taste.

title: Doctor's Appointment Via App
Management: Fredrik Jung Abbou, Johannes Schildt, Sabina Wizander
description: KRY is a digital health startup, providing its users a modern care experience by offering a digital healthcare center where patients can meet a doctor via video. The app is developed for patients who need healthcare for medical concerns that do not require a physical examination for diagnosis. KRY is an approved healthcare provider and is therefore subject to the same rules and regulations as all other providers of healthcare in Sweden. KRY was founded in Stockholm 2014 by Fredrik Jung Abbou, Josefin Landgård, Joachim Hedenius and Johannes Schildt.

title: Supporting Medium Enterprises In Optimizing Their Online B2B Presence
description: Kyto is a Software as a Service company, which supports small and medium enterprises in optimizing and increasing their international online B2B presence. The proprietary platform synchronizes entered company and product data with a global network of business directories, market places, and search engines. In this way Kyto allows its customers to generate more leads and sales online in a cost and time efficient way. Kyto is supported by recognized investors and experts, and has established a strong network of international publishing partners, such as Europages, IndustryStock, EC21 and more. Kyto is headquartered in Berlin and was founded in May 2013 by Dr. Martin Mittermeier and Paul Wulff.

title: Europe's Leading Online Retailer of Lighting Fixtures
Management: Thomas Rebmann (CEO), Andreas Rebmann (COO), Oliver Merz
description: Headquartered in Schlitz, Germany, Lampenwelt is Europe’s leading online-specialist for lamps and lights, with over 1.5 million customers. Founded in 2004, Lampenwelt employs around 300 staff and offers some 50,000 products to suit all styles and purposes. The goal of the e-Commerce pioneer is to offer every client their dream lighting solution. As well as quality own-brand products, Lampenwelt offers a wide range of lamps and lighting from top brands such as FLOS, Serienlighting, Luceplan, Tecnolumen or Swarovski. Online shops in 14 European countries form the basis of Lampenwelt’s success, underlined by over 100,000 positive customer evaluations on independent evaluation portals. Lampenwelt’s German store is available at www.lampenwelt.de.

title: Platform for individual sheet metal parts
Management: Adrian Raidt, Christoph Rößner, Jonas Schweizer
description: Laserhub has developed a vertically integrated, multi-vendor procurement platform for individual sheet metal parts. The start-up fully automatically links the demands of the customers with the resources of the providers. This reduces both process and parts costs as well as the order and processing time. Orders from the fields of laser cutting, bending / folding and further processing can be implemented via the platform. Laserhub takes care of the entire process: from automatic offer preparation to order placement, implementation, logistics, and billing.

title: Data-Driven Platform For Private Wealth Management
description: At the core of LIQID is an intuitive digital platform. LIQID combines the competence, instruments and conditions of exclusive family offices, which up until now have been reserved for ultra-high net worth individuals alone, and makes them available to the target group of successful entrepreneurs and wealthy individuals of a new generation. The company’s investment strategies for digital and mobile use were developed together with HQ Trust, the renowned multi-family office of the Harald Quandt Family. The company LIQID Investments GmbH was established in February 2015 by an internationally experienced five-member founding team, which includes media manager and entrepreneur Christian Schneider-Sickert as well as manager and private banker Dr. Kyros Khadjavi.

title: Lightweight Cloud Solution For Managing Performance Reviews
description: Loopline Systems offers a lightweight SaaS solution which is easy to implement and provides ongoing, actionable insights for executives and employees by linking data on performance with personal potential and contentment. By means of guided processes, loopline fosters individual commitment, enabling high-quality feedback and development. The Berlin-based company was founded in 2014. The founders Nora Heer and Christian Kaller were no strangers to the challenges attached to setting up a top notch performance-development tool for the enterprise market on the organizational and individual level: Combining more than ten years of HR experience with a background in entrepreneurial, technology-driven companies as well as leading corporations. In startups and small companies loopline drives professional maturing of HR, while dynamizing performance development in larger organizations.

title: Data-Driven Solutions For Display Advertising Campaigns
Investment: Series A Exited in November 2013 to Zanox
Management: Tobias Schlottke, Christian Müller, Philip Westermeyer
description: Metrigo provides custom-made, innovative and data-driven solutions for direct response driven display advertising campaigns. metrigo’s proprietary Demand Side Platform (DSP) includes Data Management, Real Time Bidding and Ad Serving. It allows its customers to reach quantitative conversion and objectives via display advertising, with a focus on prospecting.

title: Machine learning for industrial robots
Management: Dominik Welland, Joscha Bach, Priska Herger, Ronnie Vuine, Ulrik Deichsel
description: A robotics software company headquartered in Germany, micropsi industries is driving the future of industrial automation. Its unique control system, Mirai, applies artificial intelligence technologies to create flexible, real- time controlled robotic applications for use in dynamic environments and execute complex tasks. Mirai learns by rehearsing movements from humans guiding the robot and trains them within hours vs. days of creating complicated programming that other systems require. Its technology is designed for global electronics assembly and manufacturing industries and works with hardware platforms such as ABB and Universal Robots. To learn more, please visit micropsi-industries.com.

title: Data Analysis For Offline Retailers
Investment: Seed (Exited in May 2017 to Telefónica NEXT)
description: Minodes is an innovative SaaS solution for retail stores to increase sales performance and sustainably improve customer's shopping experience. Retailers may use the platform in various ways, for example to measure and optimize marketing campaigns and shop window designs, or develop targeted, location-based marketing activities. The Minodes campaign tool allows retailers to act directly upon the generated insights. Minodes GmbH was founded in 2013, based in Berlin, the Managing Directors are Tim Wegner and Alexander Köth.

title: The Largest Gay Hotelier In The  World
Management: Matthieu Jost, Marc Dedonder, François de Landes, Chris Sinton
description: Founded in 2014 by Matthieu Jost, Marc Dedonder, François de Landes and Chris Sinton, misterb&b is the world’s largest marketplace connecting like-minded travellers and hosts in the LGBT community. They are able to list, discover and book welcoming accommodations worldwide with 100,000 hosts in over 135 countries. misterb&b will further pursue its global approach to bringing gay men and women together in real-life experiences while expanding its operations in Paris, Los Angeles and Lima. misterb&b’s free app is available on iOS, Android and the web.

title: Online Shop For Wellness And Health Products
description: Natue is an e-commerce with a wide portfolio of wellness and health products, such as supplements, sports nutrition, natural cosmetics, nutricosmetics, slimming products and vitamins. The mission is to be the place to be for people who look for a healthy lifestyle. Founded in December 2012 by a doctor, Fabio Katayama, and an economist, Priscila Capellato. Natue hence offers an individualized buying assistance by nutritionists and a very rich level of information about each product.

title: Nutrition From Berlin
description: The Berlin-based startup stands for smart nutrition. nu3 creates products that make a healthy and balanced lifestyle very easy. Whether it’s a healthy diet, reaching personal fitness goals or losing weight, nu3 combines efficacy with great taste from the best ingredients to enable you to succeed. The company was founded in 2011, and is headed-up by the managing directors Dr. Robert Sünderhauf and Kassian Ortner. nu3 has online shops in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and France, and also offers an international shop on www.nu3.com

title: High Quality Online Printed Products
description: Onlineprinters GmbH is one of Europe's leading online print providers. In line with the motto "Print simply online!" the company sells printed products to 500,000 customers in 30 European countries through its 15 web shops. Internationally, the company is known under the brand name "Onlineprinters"; in Germany it operates under the name "diedruckerei.de". The product range comprises 1,400 printed products from business cards, stationery and flyers to catalogues, brochures and large-format advertising systems. The formula to successfully produce customised prints in terms of Industry 4.0 rests on three pillars: online sales, fully integrated production from ordering to shipping and gang run printing. The latter uses so-called combined forms to collectively produce print jobs, therefore minimising costs and reducing the environmental impact. Selected products allow customers to choose the option of same day printing (produced on the same working day), overnight delivery, climate neutral production and custom size specification. Onlineprinters GmbH employs a staff of 600 and produces over two billion printings per year.

title: Making Opinions Matter
Management: Cornelius Frey, Max Meran, Pia Frey
description: Opinary is a Berlin-based startup that has established a new way for users to share their opinions in online content. The startup was founded 2015 by the siblings Pia and Cornelius Frey and their Co-Founder Max Meran to help more than 70 million monthly users to share their view with a tap and understand opinion trends at a glance.

title: Learn by giving feedback
Management: David Kofoed Wind, Malthe Jørgensen, Simon Lind
description: Peergrade is an EdTech startup that gives students a better learning experience with faster and more thorough feedback from their peers. Peer grading offers a way to dramatically reduce the time teachers spent on grading while increasing the quantity of the feedback. Students hand in their work and give feedback to each other. This way students get much more feedback without extra work for the teachers.Through their platform teachers can also get insights into student performance over time based on data. Most importantly, reading and providing feedback on other's assignments is an excellent learning opportunity.Based in Copenhagen, Peergrade was founded in 2015 by David Kofoed Wind, Malthe Jørgensen, and Simon Lind.

title: Fresh And Natural Pet Food For Cats And Dogs
description: Pets Deli, the Berlin-based multichannel pet food brand, has the mission to deliver fresh and healthy pet food for caring pet owners. All products, like basic food, supplements, snacks and dried meat, are 100% food-grade quality, natural and species-appropriate. Besides their webshop, Pets Deli runs two stationary shops in Berlin. The company was founded in January 2014 by David Spanier and David Reinecke.

title: B2B Lead Generation Platform
description: ProCompra is a marketplace connecting providers and buyers of premium services & products with the mission to facilitate purchase decisions for SMEs in Brazil. As a B2B lead generation platform, ProCompra provides buyers with three offers from independent local suppliers. This allows more qualified purchasing decision. ProCompra was founded in September 2014 as an incubation project of Project A Ventures Latam.

title: Medical Treatments abroad
Management: Dr. Sophie Chung and Gero Graf
description: Qunomedical is a medical travel provider that helps patients worldwide to find high-quality care abroad at an affordable price. The Berlin-based startup was founded in 2015 and enables patients to get offers from clinics for almost any kind of treatment and to choose the most suitable offer with ease. The company only cooperates with renowned clinics and hospitals which adhere to the highest certification standards and which are highly experienced in dealing with international patients. Qunomedical’s passionate team of experts is led by Doctor Sophie Chung.

title: The World's Leading Online Art Gallery
description: Saatchi Art is the world’s leading online art gallery, connecting people with art and artists they love. Saatchi Art offers an unparalleled selection of paintings, drawings, sculpture and photography in a range of prices, and it provides artists from around the world with an expertly curated environment in which to exhibit and sell their work. Saatchi Art is redefining the experience of buying and selling art by making it easy, convenient and welcoming for both collectors and artists.

title: User Intelligent Platform For Data-Driven Advertising
description: Semasio GmbH develops and markets a SaaS platform that turns every contact an agency or advertiser has with internet users into profile data. Based on these data, the platform generates target groups for specific marketing goals. The profiling and target group generation processes rely solely on statistical modeling and machine learning. Founded in 2010 the company is headquartered in Hamburg with development centers in Denmark and Portugal. Semasio’s customers include large media and performance agencies.

title: Logistics for Full Truck Loads
Management: Julius Köhler, David Nothacker, Nicolaus Schefenacker
description: sennder GmbH is a digital road-freight-forwarder, headquartered in Berlin. The company connects shippers with carriers through an inhouse developed platform. Offering its partners a 360° full service, sennder’s software provides real time bookings as well as precise live tracking, resulting in greater transparency of the logistics supply chain.sennder was founded in 2015 by Nicolaus Schefenacker, David Nothacker, and Julius Köhler.

title: E-Commerce Technology For Category Leaders
Management: Alexander Graf, Nils Seebach, Boris Lokschin, Fabian Wesner
description: Spryker Systems provides the proprietary commerce framework Spryker, a customizable and scalable solution for corporations. The company was founded in November 2014 by Nils Seebach and Alexander Graf as a Joint Venture with Project A Ventures. Based on PHP architecture and with its modular approach, Spryker enables retailers to quickly adapt, scale and innovate their digital business. Individual requirements can easily be integrated in order to meet customer needs, including data driven approaches in the fields of Business Intelligence, CRM, and Online Marketing. Spryker has been developed under the leadership of Project A's CTO Fabian Wesner as well as co-founder and Managing Director Dr. Florian Heinemann. The framework has been deployed for numerous successful e-commerce businesses such as Tirendo, nu3 or Contorion.

title: Targeted, Measurable And Scalable Live Communication
Management: Dr. Marlon Braumann, Peter Gundel, Emil Kabisch und Sven Wissebach
description: store2be provides companies and agencies interested in advertising their goods or services with the possibility to book measurable and scalable live communication directed precisely at target groups. With a couple of clicks, spaces for advertisements and promotional actions in shopping centres and at independent retailers, institutes of higher education, cinemas and events can be leased temporarily on store2be.com. In addition, store2be offers the possibility to book additional services such as help with setting up stands, logistical assistance or even personnel. All of the important elements for successful live communication can thus be obtained all in one convenient package from a single provider. In the process, store2be makes appropriate recommendations for its customers’ needs regarding frequency and target groups. Over 1,000 spaces all across Germany are already available for booking through store2be.com today. store2be.com is managed by WHU alumni Dr. Marlon Braumann and Sven Wissebach and KIT graduates Emil Kabisch and Peter Gundel. store2be was founded in 2015 in the context of the Karlsruhe-based incubator CyberLab and has been officially headquartered in Berlin since summer 2016.

title: Free DIY E-Commerce Platform
Management: Carl Rivera, Kaj Drobin, Birk Nilson, Siavash Ghorbani
description: Tictail is a free-to-use e-commerce platform which launched in May 2012. The startup was created by Swedish entrepreneur Carl Waldekranz and co-founders Kaj Drobin, Birk Nilson, and Siavash Ghorbani in Stockholm in May 2011. Tictail provides retailers – whether established businesses or new entrepreneurs – with all of the tools necessary to create an online store, ready to accept orders within a matter of minutes, and all for free. With no need for coding or web-design experience, Tictail lets users create a beautiful online shop through its intuitive and accessible interface, offering an extensive range of templates, layouts, and themes. Tictail’s goal is to become the most used and loved e-commerce platform globally. While the basic Tictail service is free, optional apps - for example custom domains, discount codes, analytics, and the ability to sell downloadable digital content – can be purchased, adding extra functionality as and when a business needs it. The focus is on a strong community integration, user friendly and beautiful, adaptable design, which was highlighted by Wired Magazine when they named Tictail as one Europe’s hottest startups in 2012.

title: E-Commerce For Tires And Car Parts
Investment: Seed Exited in September 2013 to Delticom (€50 million)
description: The Tirendo Holding GmbH is an European online tire dealer and car accessories shop. In order to always offer the best service, Tirendo relies on a dynamic team of experienced industry experts, Internet professionals and tire specialists. The goal is to provide customers a novel and straightforward buying experience with professionalism, passion and innovation as well as excellent value for money. The main focus is on quality, speed and on competent customer service.

title: Free Price Comparison For Car Parts
Investment: Seed Sold to Delticom in  August 2014
description: Toroleo is a free product and price comparison website for car parts, car accessories and car services. The platform enables users to compare products across all price and quality levels in a clear and comfortable way. After choosing the favorite retailer, products can be directly ordered in a suitable partner shop. Toroleo provides its customers with an independent and transparent market overview.

title: Germany's first mobile and commission-free broker
Management: Christian Hecker, Thomas Pischke, Marco Cancellieri
description: Trade Republic Bank is Germany’s first mobile-only and commission-free broker. Users only pay a fee of 1 euro per transaction for the external settlement. The Berlin fintech’s app provides fast, mobile account opening, intuitive search and filter functions, a personal timeline as well as extended trading hours from 7:30 am to 11 pm. Investors can trade more than 6,500 German and international stocks as well as over 500 ETFs on indexes, commodities and currencies commission-free. Stock price quality is supervised by the Hamburg stock exchange. Spreads are bound to the reference market XETRA (Deutsche Börse) when applicable. In addition, around 40,000 HSBC Germany derivatives based on indexes, currencies and commodities can be traded commission-free. With its cutting-edge technology, Trade Republic realizes cost advantages and passes them onto its customers: no commission fees, no account fee, no negative interest rates – just a flat rate of 1 euro per trade for third-party fees. Trade Republic cooperates with renowned partners like HSBC and solarisBank. Trade Republic Bank holds a German banking license and is supervised by the Bundesbank as well as the Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin). The Berlin-based company was founded in 2015 by Christian Hecker, Thomas Pischke and Marco Cancellieri. In January 2019, Trade Republic was the first German broker to launch mobile-only and permanently commission-free stock trading. Trade Republic’s investors include venture capital investors Creandum and Project A as well as sino AG.

title: Marketplace For Hair And Beauty Treatments
Investment: Series A Exited in June 2015 to Wahanda (€ 34 million)
description: With over 2,500 connected spas and salons in more than 50 cities in The Netherlands, Belgium and Germany, Treatwell is the biggest and fastest growing online marketplace for hair and beauty services in Continental Europe. The company was established by five co-founders, went live in October 2013, and has seen month-on-month growth of 20%. Treatwell allows consumers to search, compare and book treatments via its website or app, and offers spas and salons a free lightweight SaaS solution to help support new and loyal customers in their user experience.

title: Travelling done right for best agers
description: trendtours is one of the leading German direct tour operators. The company offers air, bus and boat trips as well as cure, adventure and recreational holidays and caters to an older target group aged 55 and above. So far these offers are used by approximately 400,000 customers per year.  Project A, together with Bregal, invested and thus arranged the succession of the founder Werner Scheidel. As an operative co-investor, Project A will support the business of trendtours especially in the digital transformation of the company.

title: Increasing A Company's Presence In Online Directories
description: Uberall is a global leader in location marketing technology. Its flagship Location Marketing Cloud platform empowers the world’s biggest brands to connect with their customers and turn online interactions into offline sales. Uberall gives businesses central control of their digital presence and online reputation, enabling them to easily manage brand interactions in real-time on all digital platforms—mobile, voice and desktop—across websites, mobile apps, store locators, search engines, maps, social platforms, and advertising networks. The Location Marketing Cloud provides a consistent, accurate digital brand footprint that helps businesses capture new customers and maximize revenue for every location. Uberall is headquartered in Berlin, with additional offices in San Francisco, London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Cape Town. Its clients include Fortune 500 companies and industry leaders from all over the world.

title: Shared electric scooters for Europe’s streets
Management: Fredrik Hjelm, Douglas Stark, Adam Jafer, Filip Lindvall
description: Voi is a Swedish e-scooter startup creating a system of electrically powered scooters around urban centers. The company's goal is to provide an affordable, sustainable, and exhilarating way to commute while helping people to reduce their carbon footprint and cities to have a more sustainable transportation network.

title: Curated Premium Wines
description: Wine in Black is a startup with an innovative online wine concept and belongs to the fastest growing companies in the field of wine e-commerce. In its exclusive online shop, Wine in Black offers a constantly changing assortment of premium wines, curated by experienced wine experts. Every type of wine is presented with additional information regarding quality and origin which enables the customers to find a wine for every individual taste. Wine in Black therefore facilitates easy and fast wine shopping, even for unexperienced wine lovers. The company is based in Berlin and was founded in June 2011 by Christian Hoya and Stephan Linden.

title: Personalized Storytelling For Kids
description: Wonderbly is a full-stack publisher that lives on the intersection of storytelling, engineering, digital and print. The company combines the power of stories with the possibilities of technology to create personalized experiences for kids. Their first personalized children’s book sold over 1.5 million times and shipped to over 150 countries. The London-based company was founded in 2012 by Asi Sharabi, David Cadji-Newby, Tal Oron and Pedro Serapicos.

title: International Online Money Transfer Service
Management: Breon Corcoran (CEO), Ismail Ahmed (Founder, Executive Chairman)
description: WorldRemit is an online service that lets people send money to friends and family living abroad, using a computer, smartphone or tablet. It is a convenient, low-cost alternative to traditional money transfer companies that use high street agents and charge unreasonable fees. Money can be received as a bank deposit, cash pick-up, Mobile Money, or mobile airtime top-up. WorldRemit’s service is available to senders in 50 countries. It offers transfers to more than 140 destinations across Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia and the Americas.

title: Surfing The Internet Encrypted And Securely
description: ZenMate is the first product by ZenGuard, a startup based in Berlin. The company wants to improve internet security for its users and make it accessible to the general public. The browser add-on ZenMate’s functionality, is similar to a VPN connection and can be added with just one click. Once installed, ZenMate encrypts browser traffic, unlocks geo-restrictions and hides the original IP in order to protect the user’s privacy and identity. Because of its easy handling and advanced functionality, the plugin provides home network, WiFi and en route security. ZenMate is available on multiple browser platforms (Chrome, Opera, Firefox), as an app (android, iOS) and desktop version (Win, Mac), and therefore offers secure protection in any situation. Under the „ZenMate“ brand there are additional products available, for example the web firewall ZenMate Pulse and the mobile security solution ZenMate Sense. Altogether this offers a complete protection portfolio to its end clients. Zenguard was founded in 2013 by CEOs Simon Specka and Markus Hänel in Manchester and belongs to the first funding round of Axel Springer’s Plug and Play programs.
